A moderate earthquake with magnitude 5 (ml/mb) was detected on Thursday, south of Panama (0 miles).
Event ids that are associated to the earthquake: us6000nh8m.
Id of event: us6000nh8m.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 km (6 miles).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: south of Panama.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4 (ml/mb) was detected on Thursday, 140 km E of Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk, Russia (87 miles).
Event ids that are associated to the earthquake: us7000mzye.
Id of event: us7000mzye.
Exact time and date of earthquake 18/07/24 / 2024-07-18 05:53:25 / July 18, 2024 @ 5:53 am UTC/GMT.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 140 km E of Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk, Russia.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.6 (ml/mb) was reported south of the Kermadec Islands (0 miles) on Tuesday.
Exact location of earthquake, longitude -178.1669 West, latitude -32.7492 South, depth = 10 km.
Event ids that are associated to the earthquake: us7000my2b.
Id of event: us7000my2b.
Read more about the earthquake, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters, Location and details about this quake, that has struck: south of the Kermadec Islands.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.3 (ml/mb) was reported 6 kilometers (4 miles) from Zhangfeng in China on Friday.
All ids that are associated to the event: us6000nh53.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 12.956 km (8 miles).
Epicenter of the earthquake was 62 km (39 miles) from Bhamo (c. 47 900 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 6 km NE of Zhangfeng, China.

messages.message:
CANTON, Ga.—A weather system that produced severe thunderstorms late into the night in the Southeast left one man dead in Georgia, caused damage in a South Carolina town and left hundreds of thousands of electricity customers without power for a time.
Power outages in southeastern Tennessee and northern Georgia had declined to about 30,000 by Wednesday morning, down from more than 200,000 in Georgia alone.
Wednesday’s remaining outages were most concentrated around the town of Ellijay in the north Georgia mountains.
In Orangeburg, South Carolina, straight-line winds caused damage in the city’s downtown district, blowing down metal from roofs and wood from awnings of downtown businesses.
Officials across southeastern Tennessee and northern Georgia said roads were blocked Wednesday because of downed trees and power lines.

Severe storms in Georgia and other Southeast US states leave 1 dead and cause widespread power outagesA huge tree on Old St. Augustine Road rests on downed power lines in Tallahassee, Fla., Friday, May 10, 2024.
Powerful storms with damaging high winds threatened several states in the Southeast early Friday.
Power outages in southeastern Tennessee and northern Georgia had declined to about 30,000 by Wednesday morning, down from more than 200,000 in Georgia alone.
In Orangeburg, South Carolina, straight-line winds caused damage in the city’s downtown district, blowing down metal from roofs and wood from awnings of downtown businesses.
Officials across southeastern Tennessee and northern Georgia said roads were blocked Wednesday because of downed trees and power lines.

Unrelenting heat to keep US sweating during final month of summerThe scorching heat is expected to continue through the end of an already sweltering summer, according to NOAA’s latest climate forecast for August 2024.
NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center issued its 30-day outlook for August – the final full month of summer – and it looks like Americans are in for much of the same above-average heat that has dominated this summer so far.
People walk along the coast as the sun sets on the Pacific Ocean at Windansea Beach in La Jolla during a summer heat wave on July 23, 2024 in San Diego, California.
An active hurricane season in the Atlantic – with a possible new tropical system approaching the Southeast during the first week of August – could easily bring enough rain to exceed monthly normal precipitation for the final month of summer.
Original article source: Unrelenting heat to keep US sweating during final month of summer

The scorching heat is expected to continue through the end of an already sweltering summer, according to NOAA’s latest climate forecast for August 2024.
NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center issued its 30-day outlook for August – the final full month of summer – and it looks like Americans are in for much of the same above-average heat that has dominated this summer so far.
August US temperature outlookNOAA’s temperature outlook shows above-average temperatures across most of the contiguous US and the northeast half of Alaska.
The Plains, Southeast and Gulf Coast states are forecast to begin August with a heat wave bringing dangerous heat to those regions through next week.
NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center issued its 30-day outlook for August – the final full month of summer – and it looks like Americans are in for much of the same above-average heat that has dominated this summer so far.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.2 (ml/mb) was reported 120 km E of Bitung, Indonesia (75 miles) on Friday.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
The 4.2-magnitude earthquake has occurred at 06:14:53 / 6:14 am (local time epicenter).
The epicenter of the earthquake was roughly 49.828 km (31 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 120 km E of Bitung, Indonesia.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.2 (ml/mb) strikes 56 kilometers (35 miles) from Misawa in Japan on Friday.
Exact time and date of earthquake 19/07/24 / 2024-07-19 08:08:08 / July 19, 2024 @ 8:08 am UTC/GMT.
The epicenter was at a depth of 60.438 km (38 miles).
The epicenter was 65 km (41 miles) from Hachinohe (c. 239 000 pop), 68 km (42 miles) from Mutsu (c. 49 200 pop), 56 km (35 miles) from Misawa (c. 42 800 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 56 km NE of Misawa, Japan.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.1 (ml/mb) strikes 89 km WNW of Ollagüe, Chile (55 miles) on Wednesday.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 100.684 km (63 miles).
Exact location of earthquake, -69.0314° West, -20.8866° South, depth 100.684 km.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 89 km WNW of Ollagüe, Chile.

A government statement says the landslide Wednesday blocked the river that feeds into the Fraser River, and a sudden release of water “may cause rapid rises in river levels downstream along the Fraser River” south to Hope, B.C.
The River Forecast Centre has issued a flood warning for the Chilcotin River upstream of the landslide and a flood watch downstream.
A landslide along the Chilcotin River near Williams Lake, B.C.
Flooding is a major concern after a landslide blocked the Chilcotin River in British Columbia's Interior.
THE CANADIAN PRESS/HO-Central Cariboo Search and Rescue *MANDATORY CREDIT *A flood watch is also in place for the Fraser River from the Chilcotin River confluence to Hope as well as a high streamflow advisory for the Fraser River west of Hope.

A sudden release of water from the blocked Chilcotin River "may cause rapid rises in river levels downstream along the Fraser River" south to Hope, the government says.
A government statement says the landslide Wednesday blocked the river that feeds into the Fraser River, and a sudden release of water "may cause rapid rises in river levels downstream along the Fraser River" south to Hope, B.C.
The River Forecast Centre has issued a flood warning for the Chilcotin River upstream of the landslide and a flood watch downstream.
A flood watch is also in place for the Fraser River from the Chilcotin River confluence to Hope as well as a high streamflow advisory for the Fraser River west of Hope.
Evacuation orders issued Wednesday remain in place, covering 107 kilometres along both sides of the Chilcotin River, after the Cariboo Regional District said there was an immediate danger to life and safety due to flooding.

— British Columbia's Ministry of Land and Water says personnel are conducting assessments near a landslide that blocked the Chilcotin River in the province's Interior, including to understand risks that might exist downstream.

Evacuation orders issued Wednesday remain in place, covering 107 kilometres along both sides of the Chilcotin River, after the Cariboo Regional District said there was an immediate danger to life and safety due to flooding.

Disasters cause a cascade of financial problems for rentersPeople who rent face unique challenges after weather disasters.
As a result, in the immediate aftermath of a disaster, renters often face huge bills, starting with rent itself.
Ryan Kellman / NPR / NPR A building lists towards the water along Big Pine Island Road in Matlacha, Fla., as the sun sets in June.
“Disaster creates disaster,” James says.
Ryan Kellman / NPR / NPR After the storm Venus James and her husband relocated to outside Tampa.

Read on: To learn about common vulnerabilities of renting as the climate crisis worsens, and what is being done to combat the issue...
Nearly two years later, James and her husband are still trying to recover from the financial gut-punch of the storm.
Ryan Kellerman / NPR )As a result, in the immediate aftermath of a disaster, renters often face huge bills, starting with rent itself.
“Disaster creates disaster,” James says.
"Disaster creates disaster," says hurricane survivor Venus James.

A massive amount of debris from a landslide damming the Chilcotin River in British Columbia’s central Interior could give way within the next 24 to 48 hours.
Wagner told a news briefing that the riverbed below the slide is dry, and officials aren’t certain about the potential downstream impacts when the dam is breached.
But she says it’s clear there would be “a mass of water” coming down the Chilcotin, which flows south into the Fraser River.
Evacuation orders span 107 square kilometres along the Chilcotin, with the regional officials saying the slide poses an “immediate danger to life and safety.”The district says 60 properties are covered by the orders, including 12 homes with an estimated 13 residents.
Wagner says the slide is “massive,” with material piled 30 metres high and stretching 600 metres in length, completely blocking the flow of the Chilcotin.

— A massive amount of debris piled 30 metres high from a landslide has dammed the Chilcotin River in British Columbia's central Interior, creating a lake that a regional official says could give way within the next 24 to 48 hours.
— A massive amount of debris piled 30 metres high from a landslide has dammed the Chilcotin River in British Columbia's central Interior, creating a lake that a regional official says could give way within the next 24 to 48 hours.
But she said it's clear there would be "a mass of water" coming down the Chilcotin, which flows south into the Fraser River.
The province has warned people to stay away from the banks of the Chilcotin River below the slide all the way down to the Fraser River north of Hope, about 150 kilometres east of Vancouver.
The forecast centre says the eventual breach of the landslide debris could also lead to an "outburst flood" with a surge of water rapidly flowing downstream.
